title: Here's your PS Plus games for April
description: Sony has announced the next batch of monthly titles coming to its PlayStation Plus subscription service. Read more
author: Victoria Kennedy
excerpt: Sony has announced the next batch of monthly titles coming to its PlayStation Plus subscription service.
text: Image credit: Sony/Eurogamer Sony has announced the next batch of monthly titles coming to its PlayStation Plus subscription service. As of 1st April (not fooling), PlayStation Plus members across all subscription tiers will be able to get their hands on the following three titles: RoboCop: Rogue City | PS5 The Texas Chain Saw Massacre | PS4, PS5 Digimon Story: Cyber Sleuth – Hacker's Memory | PS4 The Death of Console Exclusives Is Inevitable and I Don't Know How I Feel About It The Death of Console Exclusives Is Inevitable and I Don't Know How I Feel About It. Watch on YouTube We awarded RoboCop: Rogue City three stars on its release. "While Rogue City might not do much that's new, it is for the most part a convincing facsimile of the old," reads Eurogamer's RoboCop: Rogue City review. "Alongside being Teyon's best game, Rogue City is a welcome example of a style of game that doesn't get made much anymore. At some point during the 2010s, the upstart AA contender was brutally shot to death by a cackling gang of megabudget prestige titles and worthy indie games. In Rogue City, Teyon has brought it back to life, armed, armoured, and ready for duty." The Texas Chain Saw Massacre also got three Eurogamer stars on release. "A delightfully macabre homage, this asymmetrical horror could finally threaten Dead by Daylight's crown, if you didn't spend more time fighting the servers than Leatherface himself," reads Eurogamer's Texas Chain Saw Massacre review. RoboCop: Rogue City, The Texas Chain Saw Massacre and Digimon Story: Cyber Sleuth – Hacker's Memory will be available for those on PS Plus to claim until 5th May. Image credit: PlayStation As a reminder, with the approach of a new month, it does mean this is your last chance to get your mitts on March's PS Plus games. PlayStation Plus members have until 31st March - that's this coming Monday - to add Dragon Age: The Veilguard, Sonic Colors: Ultimate and Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: The Cowabunga Collection to their game library. You'll find more details on what else is on offer in our full PlayStation Plus guide here.
html:
Sony has announced the next batch of monthly titles coming to its PlayStation Plus subscription service.

As of 1st April (not fooling), PlayStation Plus members across all subscription tiers will be able to get their hands on the following three titles:

  • RoboCop: Rogue City | PS5
  • The Texas Chain Saw Massacre | PS4, PS5
  • Digimon Story: Cyber Sleuth – Hacker's Memory | PS4

We awarded RoboCop: Rogue City three stars on its release. "While Rogue City might not do much that's new, it is for the most part a convincing facsimile of the old," reads Eurogamer's RoboCop: Rogue City review.

"Alongside being Teyon's best game, Rogue City is a welcome example of a style of game that doesn't get made much anymore. At some point during the 2010s, the upstart AA contender was brutally shot to death by a cackling gang of megabudget prestige titles and worthy indie games. In Rogue City, Teyon has brought it back to life, armed, armoured, and ready for duty."

The Texas Chain Saw Massacre also got three Eurogamer stars on release. "A delightfully macabre homage, this asymmetrical horror could finally threaten Dead by Daylight's crown, if you didn't spend more time fighting the servers than Leatherface himself," reads Eurogamer's Texas Chain Saw Massacre review.

RoboCop: Rogue City, The Texas Chain Saw Massacre and Digimon Story: Cyber Sleuth – Hacker's Memory will be available for those on PS Plus to claim until 5th May.

As a reminder, with the approach of a new month, it does mean this is your last chance to get your mitts on March's PS Plus games.

PlayStation Plus members have until 31st March - that's this coming Monday - to add Dragon Age: The Veilguard, Sonic Colors: Ultimate and Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: The Cowabunga Collection to their game library.

You'll find more details on what else is on offer in our full PlayStation Plus guide here.
